1. "Blade Runner" (1982) - A classic, directed by Ridley Scott and starring Harrison Ford, this movie explores themes of artificial intelligence and what it means to be human.

2. "Interstellar" (2014) - Directed by Christopher Nolan, this film takes us on a journey through space and time, exploring the nature of love and humanity in the face of existential threats.

3. "The Martian" (2015) - A thrilling survival story set on Mars, directed by Ridley Scott and starring Matt Damon. The movie is full of scientific accuracy and a compelling narrative.

I hope these recommendations are helpful! Enjoy your sci-fi movie time!

2. "A Nightmare on Elm Street" (1984) - A slasher horror film that introduced the infamous character Freddy Krueger, a man with burned skin who kills his victims in their dreams.

3. "The Conjuring" (2013) - Based on a true story, this movie follows paranormal investigators Ed and Lorraine Warren as they attempt to help a family tormented by a dark presence in their home.

4. "Hereditary" (2018) - A modern horror masterpiece about a family haunted by an evil force connected to their ancestry. It's a deeply unsettling and psychologically intense film.

5. "Get Out" (2017) - This critically acclaimed horror film tackles racial themes as a young African American man visits his white girlfriend's family estate, where he becomes ensnared in a terrifying ordeal.
